column4: Hello , Are there any multiplayer car racing games for ubuntu ? That has lots of players.
check out the 'linux game tome' web site - it has a huge list of games
its a log file. there will be changes at the end.
it could be the versionof mencoder or ffmpeg its using - dosent have faac support
ive often used a tool called 'streamtuner' for saveing streams.
check the properties/about info in the player that its playing in.. it should show the stream url. you can then cut/paste into streamtuner or other apps.
nothing..
I think i found it lol.
You will need to boot a live cd to change the size of the ubuntu parittions
I am running a live cd.
install/use gparted. it should let you resize it.  There may be  some quirks if one parittion is a primary and youneed tomove space from it to a extended/logical
you may need to resize it in steps. I normally just use all primaries
you have allready resized the windows partition?
that was quick. You did hit 'apply' in gparted? soit actually did the real work?
you should be able to resize sda3 to use the unallocated space. UNLESS its in a extended/logical parittion. Perhaps  pastebin the output of 'sudo fdisk -l'
thats proberly the issue then. You need to somehow resize sda3 , THEN resize the sda5 thats in sda3 (i thinki got that right)
this is why one makes backups.. befor doing this stuff.
http://gparted.sourceforge.net/larry/resize/resizing.htm
part of the issue may be  the 'Partition table entries are not in disk order' message
yea the live cd may try to auto-use the swap.
i alwyas turn off the swap  befor i do that sort of stuff
